description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

accession.description: Accession Number is an identifier related to some aspect of imaging workflow and data management. Usage may vary across different institutions.  See for instance [IHE Radiology Technical Framework Volume 1 Appendix A](http://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/Radiology/IHE_RAD_TF_Rev13.0_Vol1_FT_2014-07-30.pdf).

availability.description: Availability of study (online, offline or nearline).

modalityList.description: A list of all the Series.ImageModality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

patient.description: The patient imaged in the study.

context.description: The encounter at which the request is initiated.

started.description: Date and Time the study started.

basedOn.description: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

interpreter.description: Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content.

baseLocation.description: Methods of accessing  (e.g., retrieving, viewing) the study.

numberOfInstances.description: Number of SOP Instances in Study.

reason.description: Description of clinical codition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested.

description.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Study performed.

series.description: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

allOf.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

type.description: The service type for accessing (e.g., retrieving, viewing) the DICOM instances.

url.description: The service URL for accessing the study. The interpretation of the URL depends on the type of the service specified in ImagingManifest.study.baseLocation.type.

allOf.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

number.description: The Numeric identifier of this series in the study.

modality.description: The modality of this series sequence.

numberOfInstances.description: Number of SOP Instances in Series.

availability.description: Availability of series (online, offline or nearline).

baseLocation.description: Methods of accessing (e.g. retrieving) the series.

bodySite.description: Body part examined. See  DICOM Part 16 Annex L for the mapping from DICOM to Snomed CT.

laterality.description: Laterality if body site is paired anatomic structure and laterality is not pre-coordinated in body site code.

started.description: The date and time the series was started.

instance.description: A single SOP Instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

allOf.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

type.description: The service type for accessing (e.g., retrieving) the DICOM instances.

url.description: The service URL for accessing the study. The interpretation of the URL depends on the type of the service specified in ImagingManifest.study.series.baseLocation.type.

allOf.description: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

uid.description: Formal identifier for this image or other content.

number.description: The number of instance in the series.
